thinking.disposable_income: East Houston has a moderate to low disposable income, with many residents working in blue-collar jobs.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents in East Houston have limited discretionary spending, prioritizing essential goods and services.
thinking.accessibility: Public transit is crucial for East Houston residents, as many rely on it for commuting to work and accessing essential services.
thinking.decision_rationale: Given the moderate to low disposable income, it is important to minimize additional financial burdens on residents. Therefore, lower transit fares and driver fees are preferred to maintain affordability. A moderate sales tax is acceptable if it significantly improves transit services, as many residents rely on public transportation. Reducing travel time is also a priority to improve accessibility and quality of life. Balancing these factors, the selected policies aim to provide affordable and efficient transportation options while considering the financial constraints of the community.
